an6.81:1.1.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an6.81:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with six qualities is cast down to hell.

an6.81:1.3.pli: Pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, kāmesumicchācārī hoti, musāvādī hoti, pāpiccho ca, micchādiṭṭhi ca.
an6.81:1.3.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, and lie. And they have corrupt wishes and wrong view.

an6.81:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an6.81:1.4.eng: Someone with these six qualities is cast down to hell.

an6.81:2.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an6.81:2.1.eng: Someone with six qualities is raised up to heaven.

an6.81:2.3.pli: Pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, appiccho ca, sammādiṭṭhi ca.
an6.81:2.3.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, or lie. And they have few desires and right view.

an6.81:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an6.81:2.4.eng: Someone with these six qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an6.82:1.1.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an6.82:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with six qualities is cast down to hell.

an6.82:1.3.pli: Pāṇātipātī hoti, adinnādāyī hoti, kāmesumicchācārī hoti, musāvādī hoti, luddho ca, pagabbho ca.
an6.82:1.3.eng: They kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, and lie. And they’re greedy and rude.

an6.82:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ niraye.
an6.82:1.4.eng: Someone with these six qualities is cast down to hell.

an6.82:2.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge.
an6.82:2.1.eng: Someone with six qualities is raised up to heaven.

an6.82:2.3.pli: Pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti, adinnādānā paṭivirato hoti, kāmesumicchācārā paṭivirato hoti, musāvādā paṭivirato hoti, aluddho ca, appagabbho ca.
an6.82:2.3.eng: They don’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, or lie. And they’re not greedy or rude.

an6.82:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato yathābhataṃ nikkhitto evaṃ sagge”ti.
an6.82:2.4.eng: Someone with these six qualities is raised up to heaven.”

an6.83:1.1.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu abhabbo aggaṃ dhammaṃ arahattaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an6.83:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant with six qualities can’t realize the best thing, perfection.

an6.83:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu assaddho hoti, ahiriko hoti, anottappī hoti, kusīto hoti, duppañño hoti, kāye ca jīvite ca sāpekkho hoti.
an6.83:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant is faithless, shameless, imprudent, lazy, and witless. And they’re concerned with their body and their life.

an6.83:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu abhabbo aggaṃ dhammaṃ arahattaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an6.83:1.4.eng: A mendicant with these six qualities can’t realize the best thing, perfection.

an6.83:2.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo aggaṃ dhammaṃ arahattaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an6.83:2.1.eng: A mendicant with six qualities can realize the best thing, perfection.

an6.83:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho hoti, hirīmā hoti, ottappī hoti, āraddhavīriyo hoti, paññavā hoti, kāye ca jīvite ca anapekkho hoti.
an6.83:2.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant is faithful, conscientious, prudent, energetic, and wise. And they have no concern for their body and their life.

an6.83:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo aggaṃ dhammaṃ arahattaṃ sacchikātun”ti.
an6.83:2.4.eng: A mendicant with these six qualities can realize the best thing, perfection.”

an6.84:1.1.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu, no vuddhi.
an6.84:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant with six qualities can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an6.84:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu mahiccho hoti, vighātavā, asantuṭṭho, itarītaracīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārena, assaddho hoti, dussīlo hoti, kusīto hoti, muṭṭhassati hoti, duppañño hoti.
an6.84:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant has many desires—they’re frustrated and not content with any kind of robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. And they’re faithless, unethical, unmindful, and witless.

an6.84:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati hāniyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu, no vuddhi.
an6.84:1.4.eng: A mendicant with these six qualities can expect decline, not growth, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an6.84:2.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā kusalesu dhammesu, no parihāni.
an6.84:2.1.eng: A mendicant with six qualities can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.

an6.84:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na mahiccho hoti, avighātavā, santuṭṭho, itarītaracīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārena, saddho hoti, sīlavā hoti, āraddhavīriyo hoti, satimā hoti, paññavā hoti.
an6.84:2.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t have many desires—they’re not frustrated but content with any kind of robes, almsfood, lodgings, and medicines and supplies for the sick. And they’re faithful, ethical, mindful, and wise.

an6.84:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgatassa bhikkhuno yā ratti vā divaso vā āgacchati vuddhiyeva pāṭikaṅkhā, kusalesu dhammesu no parihānī”ti.
an6.84:2.4.eng: A mendicant with these six qualities can expect growth, not decline, in skillful qualities, whether by day or by night.”

an6.85:1.1.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu abhabbo anuttaraṃ sītibhāvaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an6.85:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, a mendicant with six qualities can’t realize supreme coolness.

an6.85:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ niggahetabbaṃ tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ na niggaṇhāti, yasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ paggahetabbaṃ tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ na paggaṇhāti, yasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ sampahaṃsitabbaṃ tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ na sampahaṃseti, yasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ ajjhupekkhitabbaṃ tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ na ajjhupekkhati, hīnādhimuttiko ca hoti, sakkāyābhirato ca.
an6.85:1.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant doesn’t keep their mind in check when they should. They don’t exert their mind when they should. They don’t encourage the mind when they should. They don’t watch over the mind with equanimity when they should. They have inferior convictions. They delight in substantial reality.

an6.85:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu abhabbo anuttaraṃ sītibhāvaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an6.85:1.4.eng: A mendicant with these six qualities can’t realize supreme coolness.

an6.85:2.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo anuttaraṃ sītibhāvaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an6.85:2.1.eng: A mendicant with six qualities can realize supreme coolness.

an6.85:2.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ niggahetabbaṃ tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ niggaṇhāti, yasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ paggahetabbaṃ tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ paggaṇhāti, yasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ sampahaṃsitabbaṃ tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ sampahaṃseti, yasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ ajjhupekkhitabbaṃ tasmiṃ samaye cittaṃ ajjhupekkhati, paṇītādhimuttiko ca hoti nibbānābhirato ca.
an6.85:2.3.eng: It’s when a mendicant keeps their mind in check when they should. They exert their mind when they should. They encourage the mind when they should. They watch over the mind with equanimity when they should. They have excellent convictions. They delight in extinguishment.

an6.85:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato bhikkhu bhabbo anuttaraṃ sītibhāvaṃ sacchikātun”ti.
an6.85:2.4.eng: A mendicant with these six qualities can realize supreme coolness.”

an6.86:1.1.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an6.86:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with six qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.

an6.86:1.3.pli: Kammāvaraṇatāya samannāgato hoti, kilesāvaraṇatāya samannāgato hoti, vipākāvaraṇatāya samannāgato hoti, assaddho ca hoti, acchandiko ca, duppañño ca.
an6.86:1.3.eng: They’re obstructed by deeds, defilements, or results. And they’re faithless, unenthusiastic, and witless.

an6.86:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an6.86:1.4.eng: Someone with these six qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, even when listening to the true teaching.

an6.86:2.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an6.86:2.1.eng: Someone with six qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.

an6.86:2.3.pli: Na kammāvaraṇatāya samannāgato hoti, na kilesāvaraṇatāya samannāgato hoti, na vipākāvaraṇatāya samannāgato hoti, saddho ca hoti, chandiko ca, paññavā ca.
an6.86:2.3.eng: They’re not obstructed by deeds, defilements, or results. And they’re faithful, enthusiastic, and wise.

an6.86:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattan”ti.
an6.86:2.4.eng: Someone with these six qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”

an6.87:1.1.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an6.87:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with six qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.

an6.87:1.3.pli: Mātā jīvitā voropitā hoti, pitā jīvitā voropito hoti, arahaṃ jīvitā voropito hoti, tathāgatassa duṭṭhena cittena lohitaṃ uppāditaṃ hoti, saṅgho bhinno hoti, duppañño hoti jaḷo eḷamūgo.
an6.87:1.3.eng: They murder their mother or father or a perfected one. They maliciously shed the blood of a Realized One. They cause a schism in the Saṅgha. They’re witless, dull, and idiotic.

an6.87:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an6.87:1.4.eng: Someone with these six qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, even when listening to the true teaching.

an6.87:2.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an6.87:2.1.eng: Someone with six qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.

an6.87:2.3.pli: Na mātā jīvitā voropitā hoti, na pitā jīvitā voropito hoti, na arahaṃ jīvitā voropito hoti, na tathāgatassa duṭṭhena cittena lohitaṃ uppāditaṃ hoti, na saṅgho bhinno hoti, paññavā hoti ajaḷo aneḷamūgo.
an6.87:2.3.eng: They don’t murder their mother or father or a perfected one. They don’t maliciously shed the blood of a Realized One. They don’t cause a schism in the Saṅgha. They’re wise, bright, and clever.

an6.87:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattan”ti.
an6.87:2.4.eng: Someone with these six qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”

an6.88:1.1.pli: “Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an6.88:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, someone with six qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities even when listening to the true teaching.

an6.88:1.3.pli: Tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye desiyamāne na sussūsati, na sotaṃ odahati, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, anatthaṃ gaṇhāti, atthaṃ riñcati, ananulomikāya khantiyā samannāgato hoti.
an6.88:1.3.eng: When the teaching and practice proclaimed by the Realized One is being taught they don’t want to listen. They don’t actively listen or try to understand. They learn the incorrect meaning and neglect the correct meaning. They accept views that contradict the teaching.

an6.88:1.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇantopi saddhammaṃ abhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an6.88:1.4.eng: Someone with these six qualities is unable to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities, even when listening to the true teaching.

an6.88:2.1.pli: Chahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattaṃ.
an6.88:2.1.eng: Someone with six qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.

an6.88:2.3.pli: Tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye desiyamāne sussūsati, sotaṃ odahati, aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhāpeti, atthaṃ gaṇhāti, anatthaṃ riñcati, anulomikāya khantiyā samannāgato hoti.
an6.88:2.3.eng: When the teaching and practice proclaimed by the Realized One is being taught they want to listen. They actively listen and try to understand. They learn the correct meaning and neglect the incorrect meaning. They accept views that conform with the teaching.

an6.88:2.4.pli: Imehi kho, bhikkhave, chahi dhammehi samannāgato suṇanto saddhammaṃ bhabbo niyāmaṃ okkamituṃ kusalesu dhammesu sammattan”ti.
an6.88:2.4.eng: Someone with these six qualities is able to step into the sure path with regards to skillful qualities when listening to the true teaching.”

an6.89:1.1.pli: “Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme appahāya abhabbo diṭṭhisampadaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an6.89:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, without giving up six things you can’t become accomplished in view.

an6.89:1.3.pli: Sakkāyadiṭṭhiṃ, vicikicchaṃ, sīlabbataparāmāsaṃ, apāyagamanīyaṃ rāgaṃ, apāyagamanīyaṃ dosaṃ, apāyagamanīyaṃ mohaṃ.
an6.89:1.3.eng: Substantialist view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, and forms of greed, hate, and delusion that lead to rebirth in places of loss.

an6.89:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme appahāya abhabbo diṭṭhisampadaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an6.89:1.4.eng: Without giving up these six things you can’t become accomplished in view.

an6.89:2.1.pli: Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme pahāya bhabbo diṭṭhisampadaṃ sacchikātuṃ.
an6.89:2.1.eng: After giving up six things you can become accomplished in view.

an6.89:2.3.pli: Sakkāyadiṭṭhiṃ, vicikicchaṃ, sīlabbataparāmāsaṃ, apāyagamanīyaṃ rāgaṃ, apāyagamanīyaṃ dosaṃ, apāyagamanīyaṃ mohaṃ.
an6.89:2.3.eng: Substantialist view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, and forms of greed, hate, and delusion that lead to rebirth in places of loss.

an6.89:2.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme pahāya bhabbo diṭṭhisampadaṃ sacchikātun”ti.
an6.89:2.4.eng: After giving up these six things you can become accomplished in view.”

an6.9:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these six topics for recollection.

an6.9:1.3.pli: Buddhānussati, dhammānussati, saṅghānussati, sīlānussati, cāgānussati, devatānussati.
an6.9:1.3.eng: The recollection of the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, ethics, generosity, and the deities.

an6.9:1.4.eng: These are the six topics for recollection.”

an6.90:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, an individual accomplished in view has given up these six things.

an6.90:1.3.pli: Sakkāyadiṭṭhi, vicikicchā, sīlabbataparāmāso, apāyagamanīyo rāgo, apāyagamanīyo doso, apāyagamanīyo moho.
an6.90:1.3.eng: Substantialist view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, and forms of greed, hate, and delusion that lead to rebirth in places of loss.

an6.90:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhammā diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa pahīnā”ti.
an6.90:1.4.eng: An individual accomplished in view has given up these six things.”

an6.91:1.1.pli: “Cha, bhikkhave, dhamme abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo uppādetuṃ.
an6.91:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, an individual accomplished in view can’t give rise to six things.

an6.91:1.3.pli: Sakkāyadiṭṭhiṃ, vicikicchaṃ, sīlabbataparāmāsaṃ, apāyagamanīyaṃ rāgaṃ, apāyagamanīyaṃ dosaṃ, apāyagamanīyaṃ mohaṃ.
an6.91:1.3.eng: Substantialist view, doubt, misapprehension of precepts and observances, and forms of greed, hate, and delusion that lead to rebirth in places of loss.

an6.91:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha dhamme abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo uppādetun”ti.
an6.91:1.4.eng: An individual accomplished in view can’t give rise to these six things.”

an6.92:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these six things can’t be done.

an6.92:1.3.pli: Abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo satthari agāravo viharituṃ appatisso, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo dhamme agāravo viharituṃ appatisso, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo saṅghe agāravo viharituṃ appatisso, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo sikkhāya agāravo viharituṃ appatisso, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo anāgamanīyaṃ vatthuṃ paccāgantuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo aṭṭhamaṃ bhavaṃ nibbattetuṃ.
an6.92:1.3.eng: An individual accomplished in view can’t live disrespectful and irreverent toward the Teacher, the teaching, the Saṅgha, or the training. They can’t establish their belief on unreliable grounds. And they can’t generate an eighth rebirth.

an6.92:1.4.eng: These are the six things that can’t be done.”

an6.93:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these six things can’t be done.

an6.93:1.3.pli: Abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo kañci saṅkhāraṃ niccato upagantuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo kañci saṅkhāraṃ sukhato upagantuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo kañci dhammaṃ attato upagantuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo ānantariyaṃ kammaṃ kātuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo kotūhalamaṅgalena suddhiṃ paccāgantuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo ito bahiddhā dakkhiṇeyyaṃ gavesituṃ.
an6.93:1.3.eng: An individual accomplished in view can’t take conditions to be permanent. They cannot take conditions to be happiness. They cannot take anything to be the self. They can’t do deeds with fixed result in the next life. They can’t fall back on purification through boisterous, superstitious rites. They can’t seek outside of the Buddhist community for those worthy of religious donations.

an6.93:1.4.eng: These are the six things that can’t be done.”

an6.94:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these six things can’t be done.

an6.94:1.3.pli: Abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo mātaraṃ jīvitā voropetuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo pitaraṃ jīvitā voropetuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo arahantaṃ jīvitā voropetuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo tathāgatassa duṭṭhena cittena lohitaṃ uppādetuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo saṅghaṃ bhindituṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo aññaṃ satthāraṃ uddisituṃ.
an6.94:1.3.eng: An individual accomplished in view can’t murder their mother or father or a perfected one. They can’t maliciously shed the blood of the Realized One. They can’t cause a schism in the Saṅgha. They can’t dedicate themselves to another teacher.

an6.94:1.4.eng: These are the six things that can’t be done.”

an6.95:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these six things can’t be done.

an6.95:1.3.pli: Abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo sayaṅkataṃ sukhadukkhaṃ paccāgantuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo paraṅkataṃ sukhadukkhaṃ paccāgantuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo sayaṅkatañca paraṅkatañca sukhadukkhaṃ paccāgantuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo asayaṅkāraṃ adhiccasamuppannaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ paccāgantuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo aparaṅkāraṃ adhiccasamuppannaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ paccāgantuṃ, abhabbo diṭṭhisampanno puggalo asayaṅkārañca aparaṅkārañca adhiccasamuppannaṃ sukhadukkhaṃ paccāgantuṃ.
an6.95:1.3.eng: An individual accomplished in view can’t fall back on the idea that pleasure and pain are made by oneself, or that they’re made by another, or that they’re made by both. Nor can they fall back on the idea that pleasure and pain arise anomalously, not made by oneself, by another, or by both.

an6.95:1.5.pli: Tathā hissa, bhikkhave, diṭṭhisampannassa puggalassa hetu ca sudiṭṭho hetusamuppannā ca dhammā.
an6.95:1.5.eng: It is because an individual accomplished in view has clearly seen causes and the phenomena that arise from causes.

an6.95:1.6.eng: These are the six things that can’t be done.”

an6.96:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the appearance of six things is rare in the world.

an6.96:1.3.pli: Tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmiṃ, tathāgatappaveditassa dhammavinayassa desetā puggalo dullabho lokasmiṃ, ariyāyatane paccājāti dullabhā lokasmiṃ, indriyānaṃ avekallatā dullabhā lokasmiṃ, ajaḷatā aneḷamūgatā dullabhā lokasmiṃ, kusale dhamme chando dullabho lokasmiṃ.
an6.96:1.3.eng: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha. A teacher of the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One. Rebirth in a civilized region. Unimpaired sense faculties. Being bright and clever. Enthusiasm for skillful qualities.

an6.96:1.4.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, channaṃ pātubhāvo dullabho lokasmin”ti.
an6.96:1.4.eng: The appearance of these six things is rare in the world.”

an6.97:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, these are the six benefits of realizing the fruit of stream-entry.

an6.97:1.3.pli: Saddhammaniyato hoti, aparihānadhammo hoti, pariyantakatassa dukkhaṃ hoti, asādhāraṇena ñāṇena samannāgato hoti, hetu cassa sudiṭṭho, hetusamuppannā ca dhammā.
an6.97:1.3.eng: You’re bound for the true teaching. You’re not liable to decline. You suffer only for a limited period. You have distinct knowledge. You’ve clearly seen causes and the phenomena that arise from causes.

an6.97:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cha ānisaṃsā sotāpattiphalasacchikiriyāyā”ti.
an6.97:1.4.eng: These are the six benefits of realizing the fruit of stream-entry.”

an6.98:1.1.pli: “‘So vata, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kañci saṅkhāraṃ niccato samanupassanto anulomikāya khantiyā samannāgato bhavissatī’ti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an6.98:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, it is quite impossible for a mendicant who regards any condition as permanent to accept views that conform with the teaching.

an6.98:1.2.pli: ‘Anulomikāya khantiyā asamannāgato sammattaniyāmaṃ okkamissatī’ti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an6.98:1.2.eng: Without accepting views that conform with the teaching, it’s impossible to step into the sure path.

an6.98:1.3.pli: ‘Sammattaniyāmaṃ anokkamamāno sotāpattiphalaṃ vā sakadāgāmiphalaṃ vā anāgāmiphalaṃ vā arahattaṃ vā sacchikarissatī’ti netaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.
an6.98:1.3.eng: Without stepping into the sure path, it’s impossible to realize the fruit of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, or perfection.

an6.98:2.1.pli: ‘So vata, bhikkhave, bhikkhu sabbasaṅkhāre aniccato samanupassanto anulomikāya khantiyā samannāgato bhavissatī’ti ṭhānametaṃ vijjati.
an6.98:2.1.eng: It’s quite possible for a mendicant who regards all conditions as impermanent to accept views that conform with the teaching.

an6.98:2.2.pli: ‘Anulomikāya khantiyā samannāgato sammattaniyāmaṃ okkamissatī’ti ṭhānametaṃ vijjati.
an6.98:2.2.eng: Having accepted views that conform with the teaching, it’s possible to step into the sure path.

an6.98:2.3.pli: ‘Sammattaniyāmaṃ okkamamāno sotāpattiphalaṃ vā sakadāgāmiphalaṃ vā anāgāmiphalaṃ vā arahattaṃ vā sacchikarissatī’ti ṭhānametaṃ vijjatī”ti.
an6.98:2.3.eng: Having stepped into the sure path, it’s possible to realize the fruit of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, or perfection.”

an6.99:1.1.pli: “So vata, bhikkhave, bhikkhu kañci saṅkhāraṃ sukhato samanupassanto …pe…
an6.99:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, it is quite impossible for a mendicant who regards any condition as pleasurable to accept views that agree with the teaching. …

an6.99:1.2.eng: It’s quite possible for a mendicant who regards all conditions as suffering to accept views that agree with the teaching. …”
